page.title: 07HOME FARM: BROWNHILLS.
page.content: Children from Millfield School visited this farm of 350 acres. They discovered that the land was mainly arable; barley, sugar beet and vegetables being grown. The farmer kept 17 bullocks which were being fattened for beef and were fed unsold crops and silage. Until recently there had been a small wood near the canal, but vandalism had prompted the farmer to turn the area over to grass. He had been happy for local families to picnic there, but when youths rode motorcycles through his barley crop and fired shotguns, not only at the birds, but near him, he decided that the wood must go. A 200 foot bore-hole provided water for irrigation. It was pumped up by electricity and then distributed by a system of underground pipes.
